title: Transform Raw Hiring Transcripts into Briefs & Scorecards with AI and Google Docs
author: Nicolas Le Gallo
workflow_json:
{"id":"t4GwTrKGGPLWVwVQ","meta":{"instanceId":"355814e783b7f23fbee7df866cf98dc4217f576f481e3c01da1be1f8a6912be5","templateCredsSetupCompleted":true},"name":"Generate a clean hiring brief and interview scorecards in 1 minute","tags":[],"nodes":[{"id":"680c3b20-8bfb-403f-893f-0bcb2fa82bcd","name":"Sending raw hiring brief transcript","type":"n8n-nodes-base.formTrigger","position":[-40,-80],"webhookId":"d548fe58-b28d-4011-802e-bd6e9654d591","parameters":{"options":{},"formTitle":"Upload your raw Hiring Brief (PDF)","formFields":{"values":[{"fieldType":"file","fieldLabel":"Interview transcript","requiredField":true},{"fieldLabel":"Name your document","placeholder":"Document name","requiredField":true}]}},"typeVersion":2.2},{"id":"5c131ad3-5c02-41c8-844e-6733fd75a94c","name":"Extracting text","type":"n8n-nodes-base.extractFromFile","position":[120,-80],"parameters":{"options":{},"operation":"pdf","binaryPropertyName":"Interview_transcript"},"typeVersion":1},{"id":"a3e449a4-dfb3-4521-827e-4c998c1821d5","name":"Summarizing raw transcript","type":"@n8n/n8n-nodes-langchain.openAi","position":[280,-80],"parameters":{"modelId":{"__rl":true,"mode":"list","value":"o3-mini","cachedResultName":"O3-MINI"},"options":{},"messages":{"values":[{"role":"system","content":"You are a senior tech recruiter who turns messy kickoff-call transcripts into
polished, recruiter-grade hiring briefs.

NON-NEGOTIABLES
---------------
â€¢ **Nothing useful may be discarded.** If in doubt, include it.
â€¢ Preserve colourful anecdotes, direct quotes, founder back-stories,
  culture rituals, hiring wins & fails, and spicy truths.
  They are critical for candidate sell.
â€¢ Never invent missing information; instead flag gaps under **â€œâ“ Open Questions.â€**
â€¢ Write in clear, business-casual Englishâ€”concise but human.
  Avoid marketing fluff.

OUTPUT
------
Deliver **well-formatted Markdown** with the following headings.
Omit a section only if the transcript truly contains zero information for it.

ğŸ“ **Executive Summary** â€“ 3-4 lines on whoâ€™s hiring, why, and whatâ€™s at stake.

# Company Snapshot
## Origin Story & Vision  
## Differentiation & Market Position  
## Growth Outlook (headcount, ARR, funding roadmap)

# Team & Culture
## Current Org & Key Leaders  
## Culture in Action â€“ rituals, norms, â€œno brilliant jerks,â€ etc.  
ğŸ™ï¸ **Anecdotes & War-Stories** â€“ quirky quotes, past hiring wins & fails.

# Product & Market Context
(what they build, who buys, traction, tech challenges)

# Role Overview â€“ **Senior Talent Acquisition Partner**
## Mission & Impact (first 12-18 mo)  
## Core Responsibilities  
## Success Metrics / KPIs  
## Career Growth Path

# Ideal Candidate Profile
### Must-Have Experience  
### Mindset & Personal Traits  
### Nice-to-Haves  
### Red Flags / Anti-Profiles

# Compensation & Benefits
(base, bonus, equity, perks, remote stipend, full benefit stack)

# Interview Process
(stages, owners, assignments, timing)

# Sourcing Targets & Competitor Pools
(Bain Vector, Hugging Face, etc.)

âš ï¸ **Challenges, Blockers & Strategic Notes**
(real risks, founder quirks, prior mis-hires, process pain points)

â“ **Open Questions**
(Bullets of anything missing, unclear, or contradictoryâ€”
e.g. diversity baseline, exact start date, equity cliff terms)

FORMAT RULES
------------
â€¢ Use headings, sub-headings, and bullet lists for readability.  
â€¢ Short pull-quotes are fine:  
  > *â€œWe fired clients who only want decks.â€ â€” Nicolas, COO*  
â€¢ Do NOT include Markdown code fences or extra commentaryâ€”only the brief itself.

ADDENDUM â€“ ensure these are PRESENT verbatim if they exist in the transcript:
â€¢ Benefit amounts (â‚¬1 000 WFH kit + â‚¬100/month, 30 holiday days, Alan Blue, Moka.care, Gympass).
â€¢ â€œFocus Blocksâ€ calendar etiquette.
â€¢ Recovery-score Whoop-band pilot.
â€¢ Mini-table: NLG vs. BCG Gamma vs. Artefact (speed, pricing model, equity upside).
â€¢ Heading: # Hiring Logistics & Legal Constraints (UTC-2â†”UTC+3, EOR via Remote.com, â‰¤2-month notice).
Failing to include any of the above when present triggers an **â€œOpen Question.â€**
"},{"content":"=Here is the raw transcript : {{ $json.text }}"}]}},"credentials":{},"typeVersion":1.8},{"id":"57c1aad9-7c87-4742-8a7a-7be2f6a6e0c3","name":"Generating scorecards","type":"@n8n/n8n-nodes-langchain.openAi","position":[680,-140],"parameters":{"modelId":{"__rl":true,"mode":"list","value":"o3-mini","cachedResultName":"O3-MINI"},"options":{},"messages":{"values":[{"role":"system","content":"You are a People-Ops expert.  
Your job: create **compact interview scorecards** for each stage of a hiring process.

OUTPUT REQUIREMENTS
-------------------
For **each** stage listed in the input, return **exactly**:

â€¢ **Primary Focus** â€“ one short sentence.  
â€¢ **Hard & Soft Skills to Probe** â€“ 4-8 bullet items. 
    â€“ For **each skill**, give:  
      â€¢ 2-3 sample questions (bullet list)  
      â€¢ 1 short line on what a *great* answer would include.

NO scoring tables, ratings, or long prose.

STYLE & FORMAT
--------------
â€¢ Plain text / minimal Markdown that pastes cleanly into Google Docs.  
â€¢ Use the exact stage names provided.  
â€¢ Keep bullets tight (max ~15 words each).  
â€¢ Reference role-specific cues from the brief (KPIs, culture values).  
â€¢ If info is missing, note â€œ[needs clarification]â€ instead of guessing."},{"content":"=here is the input : {{ $json.message.content }}"}]}},"credentials":{},"typeVersion":1.8},{"id":"1ab4bc8f-fb00-4e19-9228-5ca0683632f1","name":"Creating hiring brief file","type":"n8n-nodes-base.googleDocs","position":[680,80],"parameters":{"title":"={{ $('Sending raw hiring brief transcript').item.json['Name your document'] }}","folderId":"1TzPXCntKOEym3GM_s8HVyG9VNIGWe70h"},"credentials":{},"typeVersion":2},{"id":"249d8f89-7e97-42d6-87d8-8e1acb02de9d","name":"Adding brief to file","type":"n8n-nodes-base.googleDocs","position":[880,80],"parameters":{"actionsUi":{"actionFields":[{"text":"={{ $('Summarizing raw transcript').item.json.message.content }}","action":"insert"}]},"operation":"update","documentURL":"={{ $json.id }}"},"credentials":{},"typeVersion":2},{"id":"7738eab0-0be8-43a8-828d-cbcdc0fce3ef","name":"Creating Scorecards file","type":"n8n-nodes-base.googleDocs","position":[1040,-140],"parameters":{"title":"=Scorecard -  {{ $('Sending raw hiring brief transcript').item.json['Name your document'] }}","folderId":"1TzPXCntKOEym3GM_s8HVyG9VNIGWe70h"},"credentials":{},"typeVersion":2},{"id":"3781bf90-331a-4dff-af85-47f74ffebdfe","name":"Adding scorecards to File","type":"n8n-nodes-base.googleDocs","position":[1260,-140],"parameters":{"actionsUi":{"actionFields":[{"text":"={{ $('Generating scorecards').item.json.message.content }}","action":"insert"}]},"operation":"update","documentURL":"={{ $json.id }}"},"credentials":{},"typeVersion":2},{"id":"a9950174-c55f-4c47-b22a-b1bb0f17af2f","name":"Sticky Note","type":"n8n-nodes-base.stickyNote","position":[-140,-460],"parameters":{"color":5,"width":747,"height":332,"content":"### ğŸ’¡ Who is this template for ?

readme:
## Who is this template for ?

Basically anyone involved in recurring recruiting processes and looking to save a considerable amount of time and energy (Talent acquisitions Managers, recruiting consultants, hiring managers, foundersâ€¦etc)

## What it does :

  * It takes a messy and raw transcript from an â€œintake meetingâ€ between a recruiter and a Hiring manager and turns it into a **clean and exhaustive brief + scorecard templates for each interview rounds**
  * It does it under 1 MINUTE while the usual â€œmanualâ€ process usually takes several hours



## How to customize this workflow to your needs

  * Google doc is the default choice because it allows easy modification of the output, but you can choose to output this under any format and / or store it wherever you want
  * I strongly suggest to choose one of the latest LLM models for better output quality
  * Both LLM prompts can be revised to match your expectations better
